content: Airline passenger screening in the United States has evolved significantly since 9/11, with new technologies and policies overseen by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) under the Aviation Transportation and Security Act. TSA is mandated to provide comprehensive security screening for all passengers and property, with the authority to implement trusted traveler programs and expedite screening for certain passengers. The TSA has implemented technologies to expedite security screening for airline passengers, focusing on those who require more extensive screening.
